comment._content: To learn more about Mary Steichen Calderone, please visit a blog post about her - blog.photography.si.edu/2009/03/16/adventures-in-the-morgue/

comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: You can also learn more about Nathalia Clara Ruth Crane in this interesting blog post.  ;-)

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: Right you are Pixel Wrangler. Thanks!

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: The grease pencil crop marks  visible on the photo weren't made by the photographer. They were made by Science Service before they made a copy of the photo for publication.   During 1920s and 1930s, they sometimes airbrushed out backgrounds or cropped publicity photographs supplied to them by others, presumably to produce what they perceived as more suitable "head shots".
